title: Surface area of a Cone
prompt:
A party supply company makes cone-shaped party hats
for children using thin cardboard. To the nearest square
centimeter, how much cardboard is required to make the
party hat whose design is shown?
(Use π = 3.14)
hint: Think about any price "per" item, and then what operation you would use to find what 100 of those items cost.
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>The formula for the surface area of a cone is: </mtext><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><msup>
     <mi>r</mi>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
    <mo>.</mo>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Since party hats do not have a bottom, remove </mtext><mi>π</mi><msup>
     <mi>r</mi>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
    <mtext> from the</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>formula</mtext><mtext>. The amount of cardboard required is:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext> </mtext><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>3.14</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>24</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>753.6</mn><mo>≈</mo><mn>754</mn><msup>
     <mtext> cm</mtext>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
    
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
